meanings.definition: Having a surface or edge that is curved and wavy, like the edge of a scallop shell.
meanings.sent1: The scalloped edges of the dress gave it a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The scalloped design on the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The scalloped paper napkins made the table setting look fancy.
meanings.sent4: The scalloped clouds in the sky resembled ocean waves.
meanings.sent5: The scalloped pattern on the rug created a sense of movement in the room.

meanings.definition: Cooked with a sauce and often breadcrumbs or cheese on top, as in scalloped potatoes.
meanings.sent1: The scalloped potatoes were a hit at the potluck dinner.
meanings.sent2: The creamy scalloped dish melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's scalloped potatoes always disappeared quickly at family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the scalloped dish filled the kitchen with warmth.
meanings.sent5: I could never resist a second helping of those delicious scalloped potatoes.

meanings.definition: Decorated with a series of curved projections, as in a scalloped edge.
meanings.sent1: The scalloped frame around the mirror added a touch of sophistication to the room.
meanings.sent2: The scalloped trim on the curtains gave them a stylish finish.
meanings.sent3: The scalloped border on the invitation made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent4: The scalloped details on the cake made it look too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent5: The scalloped pattern on the pillow added a pop of color to the sofa.
